comment: A well respected professor, personally this class was very time consuming and I struggled in the beginning, lectures are plenty (online course) and even failed the first few quizzes. COMUNICATE with him, he is there to help and guide and even puts in the effort to reach out to you as well. He also provides feedback, weekly discussions too.
Took CRJU 3320 with him, We had 4 grades total. Research paper, midterm, and final. Great professor! Lots of great speakers.

Dr. Brown is amazing! Absolutely loved his Criminal Investigation class. He made it a point to get us interested in class material and gave his all to make sure that we understood. His class was difficult at times, with the two rather comprehensive exams (midterm and final) and a large research paper. Make sure to stay focused in his class.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Inspirational

comment: Easily the best criminal justice professor at KSU. He is super sweet and funny. His lectures are basically discussion based. However, this is not a class where you will learn in class and you will have to read the textbook and the powerpoints to learn for yourself. Easy A for minor or elective, but not best choice if you need to actually learn it.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Dr. Brown is kind and truly cares about his students. He responds to emails promptly and positively and is passionate about what he teaches. Weekly quizzes and discussion boards, an easy research paper (6-8 pgs), and open-book midterm and final (MC and some long-answer). Dr. Brown is an easy grader. I enjoyed the course. Take him if you can!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Graded by few things--Caring

comment: Professor Brown is really nice and funny, but he goes off topic a lot. He takes forever to grade assignments and doesn't really give much feedback on them. I only used the book to study for the midterm and final. As long as you put in a little effort, it's easy to pass.

I absolutely loved this class! Professor brown is so laid back and hilarious. He really seems passionate about the subject and he always gives information. Very laid back class overall and super easy!!' Would definitely recommend. Great class to balance out a heavy course load.

This class was truly the best class i've taken at Kennesaw. This class was Monday's 5:00-7:45 and I have never enjoyed a Monday class so much in my college career. I would highly recommend if you're interested in current events and want to be knowledgable about terrorism around the globe.

He was a great teacher! I really enjoyed this class, I wish he taught other classes so I could take him again. He really does seem to care about his students, he even learned our whole class' names within the first two weeks!

He was a really nice guy, he always had a smile and a great sense of humor. The class was kind of boring but he was passionate and wise about what he was teaching. 2 test , paper, participation. He gives u many opportunities to finish the research paper. Test are a little hard , if u don't study. Bought us pizza on the last day.

He is really determined to make sure you understand the content he teaches. He makes sure students don't focus on the test, but more on the material. He makes the tests easy to take, as long as you pay attention to what he says and participates. He's really nice, and truly cares about his student's success, and learning the material he teaches.

We watched informative videos just about every class. This was a Terrorism class btw. Extremely easy, he's a down to earth professor and shows no bias whatsoever which is a bit surprising. He has some very off the wall/corny jokes but it lightens the mood. Be sure to ask questions so he can become familiar with you. 88 on midterm, final unknown.

By FAR the best prof I've had in 5 yrs here. Tells you EXACTLY what will be on his tests, our class average on tests was a 92. Nicest guy ever,bought our whole class pizza just because. Asked us what day would be good for our schedule to take our exams because he didn't want to overload us. Not strict with deadlines. TAKE HIM. EASY A. No book ncsry

This class is VERY easy. Only 3 grades. One test, one final, and one paper. Tests are SO easy. Ask for a study guide and he'll give you one. Study exactly what's on the study guide and you'll pass the test. He's SO funny. You don't need to pay attention in class. Just do the study guide and you'll pass. You don't need to take notes or anything ...

I really liked this teacher. He was always in a good mood and helpful. You always knew what to expect from his tests and how he would grade. He is very understanding and compassionate, and knows the topics he teaches well.

Excellent professor! Dr. Brown absolutely knows the subject and is very passionate about it. He is without a doubt one of the most helpful professors I have had and he would not hesitate to bend over backwards in order to help a students. The work consisted of a short paper, 2 exams, and a group presentation over the information from the paper.

didn't care for the subject of the class but he was awesome. He's passionate about what he teaches and cares for the students. Would definitely take him again if he was teaching a class other than the one I'm taking now. Had a group project, one paper and two exams. exams are piece of cake. Attendance is mandatory.
